result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Status conference on December 16, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

9:52 AM case called. Prosecuting Attorney Afton Brianna Lewis in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Tong Xiong in court.  Attorney Rebecca Adams appeared by video for Tong Xiong. Defendant waives reading of Information and enters Not Guilty pleas. Court receives the pleas.

Branch 1 for further scheduling.

Order on Request to Appear Remotely
The Court Orders: Attorney Rebecca Adams may appear remotely for the proceeding scheduled on 10/06/2022. See Order for further details.
Arraignment on October 6, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Defense Counsel's Request to Appear Remotely
Same as Complaint just adding Count 4: Bail Jumping-Felony - Failing to Appear in Court.
Arraignment on October 6, 2022 at 09:30 am.

9:52 AM case called. Defendant Tong Xiong in court.  Attorney Rebecca Adams in court for Tong Xiong.  Prosecuting attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing and Court accepts waiver. Case is referred to Branch 1 to schedule an ARGN.

ADDRESS INFO for Tong Xiong
Current: 7840 June Avenue N, Brooklyn Park, MN 55443 United States  (Effective: 07-19-2022)
Prior: 909 E. Cook Ave, Saint Paul, MN 55106 United States

Conditions: 
No contact with G.S., Y.Y. 
No contact with anyone involved in illegal drug activities, except in a therapeutic setting. 
No acts or threats of violence against anyone. 
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety.

(11:43 AM case called.) Prosecuting attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Tong Xiong appeared by video, in custody in the Eau Claire County Jail. Attorney Rebecca Adams appeared by video for Tong Xiong. Attorney Ryan Glenn Kohler appeared by video for Tong Xiong from the Eau Claire County Jail.
Court orders the warrant is quashed.
Defendant waives time limits for preliminary hearing.
Defendant updates address and phone number with the Court.
State requests $10,000.00 cash bond and cites reasoning. Attorney Kohler requests no more than $5,000.00 cash bond and cites reasoning.
Court orders $8,500.00 cash bond with conditions.
Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on August 1, 2022 at 1:15 pm.
Hearing scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Conditions:
No contact with G.S., Y.Y.
No contact with anyone involved in illegal drug activities, except in a therapeutic setting. 
No acts or threats of violence against anyone.
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety.
